text.section: A certificate from the Secretary of State delivered with a copy of the document filed by the Secretary of State shall be conclusive evidence that the original document is on file with the Secretary of State.
The certificate shall bear the signature of the Secretary of State, which may be in facsimile, and the seal of the Commonwealth.

The only obligation of the Secretary of State is to certify that a document is of record, and the Secretary of State is not obligated to certify as to the accuracy of any fact set forth in a document of record.

law.history: Created 2010 Ky. Acts ch. 151, sec. 19, effective January 1, 2011.
